metadata.Title: CVE-2022-38090 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper isolation of shared resources in some Intel(R) Processors when using Intel(R) Software Guard Extensions may allow a privileged user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38090` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20230214.0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20230214.0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
